<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 133, 636, 158]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge International AS & A Level  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 183, 194, 213]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NAME  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 234, 171, 264]]<|/det|>
CENTRE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 183, 905, 270]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 288, 230, 304]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 288, 905, 303]]<|/det|>
9709/33  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 312, 309, 328]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 312, 905, 328]]<|/det|>
May/June 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[757, 337, 905, 353]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 367, 393, 383]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 395, 390, 411]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 429, 222, 445]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 868, 648]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 676, 213, 691]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 693, 728, 725]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 85, 94, 104]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 84, 761, 104]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(8^{3 - 6x} = 4 \times 5^{-2x}\). Give your answer correct to 3 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 85, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 87, 92, 106]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 84, 836, 106]]<|/det|>
Find the exact coordinates of the stationary point of the curve \(y = \mathrm{e}^{2x}\sin 2x\) for \(0\leqslant x\leqslant \frac{1}{2}\pi .\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 85, 917, 104]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 84, 96, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 84, 910, 119]]<|/det|>
The square roots of \(24 - 7\mathrm{i}\) can be expressed in the Cartesian form \(x + \mathrm{i}y\), where \(x\) and \(y\) are real and exact.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 131, 915, 150]]<|/det|>
By first forming a quartic equation in \(x\) or \(y\), find the square roots of \(24 - 7\mathrm{i}\) in exact Cartesian form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 147, 920, 165]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 84, 92, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[279, 92, 715, 300]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 313, 915, 365]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the equation \(ky = \mathrm{e}^{cx}\), where \(k\) and \(c\) are constants. The graph of \(\ln y\) against \(x\) is a straight line passing through the points (2.80, 0.372) and (5.10, 2.21), as shown in the diagram.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 375, 707, 395]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(k\) and \(c\). Give each value correct to 2 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 376, 918, 395]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 83, 97, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 83, 146, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 82, 920, 101]]<|/det|>
On an Argand diagram shade the region whose points represent complex numbers \(z\) which satisfy

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 100, 628, 121]]<|/det|>
both the inequalities \(|z - 4 - 3\mathrm{i}|\leqslant 2\) and \(\arg (z - 2 - \mathrm{i})\geqslant \frac{1}{3}\pi .\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 101, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 510, 146, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 510, 628, 529]]<|/det|>
Calculate the greatest value of \(\arg z\) for points in this region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 510, 920, 529]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 87, 99, 106]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 87, 146, 106]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 85, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
Express \(3\cos 2x - \sqrt{3}\sin 2x\) in the form \(R\cos (2x + \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0 < \alpha < \frac{1}{2}\pi\). Give the exact values of \(R\) and \(\alpha\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 101, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 100, 146, 119]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 92, 828, 128]]<|/det|>
Hence find the exact value of \(\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{12}\pi} \frac{3}{\left(3 \cos 2x - \sqrt{3} \sin 2x\right)^2} \mathrm{d}x\), simplifying your answer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 97, 917, 116]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 92, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[361, 92, 631, 241]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 259, 920, 310]]<|/det|>
A container in the shape of a cuboid has a square base of side \(x\) and a height of \((10 - x)\). It is given that \(x\) varies with time, \(t\), where \(t > 0\). The container decreases in volume at a rate which is inversely proportional to \(t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 319, 547, 342]]<|/det|>
When \(t = \frac{1}{10}\), \(x = \frac{1}{2}\) and the rate of decrease of \(x\) is \(\frac{20}{37}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 352, 144, 371]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 352, 549, 371]]<|/det|>
Show that \(x\) and \(t\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 376, 580, 413]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} = \frac{-1}{2t(20x - 3x^2)}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 384, 920, 403]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 82, 146, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 82, 740, 101]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation, obtaining an expression for \(t\) in terms of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 82, 920, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 81, 104, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 81, 420, 101]]<|/det|>
The equations of two straight lines are

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 112, 798, 133]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{r} = \mathbf{i} + \mathbf{j} + 2a\mathbf{k} + \lambda (3\mathbf{i} + 4\mathbf{j} + a\mathbf{k})\qquad \mathrm{and}\qquad \mathbf{r} = -3\mathbf{i} - \mathbf{j} + 4\mathbf{k} + \mu (- \mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j} + 2\mathbf{k}),\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 144, 292, 163]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 176, 144, 195]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 175, 918, 210]]<|/det|>
Given that the acute angle between the directions of these lines is \(\frac{1}{4}\pi\), find the possible values of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 193, 918, 212]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 82, 148, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 81, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
Given instead that the lines intersect, find the value of \(a\) and the position vector of the point of intersection.  [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 102, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 82, 562, 101]]<|/det|>
Use the substitution \(2x = \tan \theta\) to find the exact value of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 116, 571, 160]]<|/det|>
\[\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{2}}\frac{12}{\left(1 + 4x^{2}\right)^{2}}\mathrm{d}x~.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 175, 700, 195]]<|/det|>
Give your answer in the form \(a + b\pi\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are rational numbers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 175, 920, 195]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 114, 920, 147]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
